Class Lattice

java.lang.Object
  Lattice
class Lattice
extends java.lang.Object

Contains all the information and methods to manipulate a Lattice

          Change the Lattice Parameters
 void changeLatticeSize()
          Change the size of the lattice while the simulation is running If the size if decreasing, discard the hidden points If the size is increasing, randomise the extra points

          Change the number of states in the lattice and recalculate the no of points in each state

Constructor Detail

Lattice

public Lattice(int size,
               int states,
               double temp,
               double tempGradient)
Constructor for the Lattice object

Parameters:
size - Linear Size of the Lattice
states - No of Spin states in the simulation
temp - Initial temperature of the Lattice
tempGradient - Initial Heating/Cooling Gradient

                           int y)
Calculate the Energy of a single lattice point

Returns:

runMetropolis

public LatticePoint runMetropolis()
Run the Metropolis Algorithm

Returns:
The Lattice point which was selected, for Drawing the Canvas

runWolff

public LatticeCluster runWolff()
Run the Wolff Algorithm

Returns:
The Cluster which was flipped, for drawing the canvas

growCluster

private void growCluster(int x,
                         int y,
                         int oldState,
                         int newState)
Flip the selected point and try to add its neighbours to the cluster

Parameters:
x - Coordinate of the point to flip
y - Coordinate of the point to flip
oldState - The initial state of the point to flip
newState - The new state of the point to flip

                    int y,

Parameters:
x - Coordinate of the point to flip
y - Coordinate of the point to flip
oldState - The initial state of the point to flip
newState - The new state of the point to flip

changeLattice

public void changeLattice(int size,
                          int states)
Change the Lattice Parameters

Parameters:
size - The new size of the Lattice
states - The new number of states any given point can take

The size value

getStates

public int getStates()
Gets the number of states available to each spin in the Lattice

Returns:
The no of states

changeLatticeSize

public void changeLatticeSize()
Change the size of the lattice while the simulation is running If the size if decreasing, discard the hidden points If the size is increasing, randomise the extra points

public void changeNoOfStates()
Change the number of states in the lattice and recalculate the no of points in each state
